name: Fireweed Sangha of Mindful Living
address: Anchorage, Alaska 99508 United States
notes: We're a community of people in Anchorage, Alaska who practice Buddhism according to the teachings of Zen teacher Thich Nhat Hanh.

name: Big Spring Sangha
address: Bald Eagle Run, Huntsvills, Alabama 35824 United States
notes: Big Spring Sangha is a caring and inclusive community practicing in the Plum Village Tradition in Huntsville, Alabama. We meet weekly to practice sitting and walking meditation, Dharma sharing, and listen to Dharma talks. There is an opportunity to recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings once per month.

name: Gulf Shores Mindfulness Sangha
address: First Presbyterian Church, 309 E 21st Ave, Gulf Shores, Alabama 36542  United States
notes: Dharma discussions, meditation and mindful walks.

name: Dogwood Blossom Sangha
address: 401 W Mountain St, Fayetteville, AR 72701 United States
notes: Dogwood Blossom Sangha is a community in Fayetteville, Arkansas practicing mindfulness in the spirit and tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. The focus of our practice is to cultivate the energy of mindfulness, understanding, and compassion in ourselves, in our families, in our community, and in the world. We come together weekly and for other occasions, such as days of mindfulness, community service, and retreats, to practice as a sangha. We practice sitting meditation, walking meditation, and dharma sharing circles. The group is lead by an aspirant of the Order of Interbeing of Thich Nhat Hanh.

name: Flowering Mountain
address: 138 Grand Ave, Paonia, CO 81428
notes: Small, committed group of practitioners in the Plum Village Tradition.  All welcome.

name: Full Moon Sangha
address: BelMar Park, Lakewood, Colorado 80226  United States
notes: We welcome everyone from beginners to experienced practitioners. Please join us for seated meditation, walking meditation, tea and discussion. BelMar Area; please call for directions.

name: Lotus Blossom Sangha
address: Longmont, Colorado 80504 United States
notes: The Lotus Blossom Sangha meets via zoom from 7-8:45 on Tuesday evenings and once a month in person in Longmont, CO. We typically sit for 20-30 minutes, sometimes practicing walking mediation, listening to chants or guided meditations and then share a dharma teaching and dharma sharing

name: Peaceful Heart Sangha
address: Fort Collins, Colorado 80526,  United States
notes: Our Sangha practices in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition

name: Peaceful Presence Sangha
address: 6091 S Quebec Street, Centennial, CO 80111,  United States
notes: Our sangha is small (we average about 8 members each sitting) and we practice in the Plum Village tradition. We share walking meditation, silent meditation, tea meditation, a reading and dharma sharing.

name: Still Mind Sangha
address: 4962 S. Xenia St, Denver, Colorado 80237 United States
notes: We gather at 6:30 for soup and chat and begin sitting meditation at 7:00 pm. We practice guided, silent, walking and tea meditation followed by Dharma sharing.

name: Accepting Heart Sangha
address: 7 East Grand Street, Stonington, Connecticut 06378  United States
notes: Accepting Heart Sangha meets in my home in southeastern Connecticut. All are welcome. Members are, however, largely retired, the hour and the community being what they are.

name: Community of Mindfulness
address: Peace-Space Yoga Co-Op, 22 Hunters Road, Norwich, Connecticut 06360, United States
notes: Our Sangha includes sitting meditation, walking meditation, and Dharma sharing.

name: Earth Holder Sangha
address: Wisdom House Retreat and Conference Center, Marie-Louise Carriage House, 229 East Litchfield Road, Litchfield, Connecticut 06759,  United States
notes: We share the 5 MTS every other week. We walk, sit, sing, and have dharma sharing at each meeting. Sometimes we read from Thay's books, sometimes we read a sutra or a Bhodisattvah vow.

name: Harmony Sangha
address: 315 Leavenworth Rd, Shelton, Connecticut 06484 United States
notes: We are a welcoming sangha practicing in the Plum Village tradition. Our weekly practice includes sitting meditation, indoor walking meditation, and dharma sharing. There is an opportunity for outdoor walking meditation in the hour before our meeting. We enjoy regular sangha days of mindfulness. Third Thursday gathering are in Easton, CT. Visit our website for additional details.

name: New London Community of Mindfulness AM
entity: New London Community of Mindfulness AM
address: All Souls Unitarian and Universalist Church, 19 Jay Street, New London, Connecticut 06320, United States
notes: NLCM-AM is a small but warm and welcoming group, with an optional breakfast extension at the Washington Street Coffee House following our regular meeting. Our practice includes sitting meditation, walking meditation, Dharma sharing, and monthly recitation of the 5 mindfulness trainings, with readings from Thich Nhat Hanh. We're temporarily meeting virtually on Zoom.

name: Po Jama Sangha
address: North United Methodist church,300 Parker Street, Manchester, Connecticut 06042 United States
notes: We practice in the Plum Village tradition of Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh. Our practice is lighting candle offering 2-3 touchings of the earth to the 3 jewels, meditation (sit walk sit, sometimes guided, approximately 60 minutes), serve tea, tea Gatha enjoy our tea!, Dharma discussion (with facilitator offers topic or reading ). Last Tuesday of the month: 5 Mindfulness Trainings recitations. We have long retreats during the course of the year.

name: Willimantic Sangha
address: Willimantic, Connecticut 06226 United States
notes: Our Sangha includes sitting, walking, teachings, and Dharma sharing. We practice in the spirit of the Plum Village tradition.

name: Opening Heart Mindfulness Community
address: 3812 Northampton St NW, Washington DC 20015 United States
notes: The Opening Heart Mindfulness Community is open to everyone and meets to practice sitting and walking meditation and discuss mindfulness-related topics. We practice together in the tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

name: Washington Mindfulness Community
address: 5017 16th St NW, Washington, DC 20011, USA
notes: The Washington Mindfulness Community, formed in 1989, is a Buddhist community of lay practitioners inspired by the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh. We meet weekly (online during the pandemic) for sitting/walking meditation, listening to talks by Thay, Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, guest talks by dharma teachers in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hahn, and other related mindfulness practices.

name: Blooming Lotus Sangha
address: 2321 S.W. 127 Avenue, Davie, Florida 33325 United States
notes: Mindfulness practice center with resident Dharma Teachers, mindfulness instructors, and O.I. members serving People of Color (POC), members of the majority culture, and White allies for over 2 decades. We provide Days of Mindfulness, family retreats, Mindfulness in Nature programs, etc. We offer services in English, French, Portuguese, Spanish, and Vietnamese. Please visit our website for more information.

name: Broward Lotus Sangha
address: Pembroke Pines, Florida 33024 United States
notes: Community of Mindful Living with resident Dharma Teaches and members of the Order of Interbeing. Offering mindfulness practice opportunities including meditation meetings, days of mindfulness retreats, family programs, etc. Serving Broward County and other South Florida locations.

name: Caloosahatchee Rising Tide Sangha
address: 1453 Tredegar Dr, Fort Myers, Florida 33919  United States
notes: Join The Caloosahatchee Rising Tide Sangha for meditation. The evening includes sitting and walking meditation and the discussion of significant Buddhist teachings. We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition. Our weekly discussions usually involve examples of how we're applying mindfulness practices we're studying. Even if you are not familiar with the reading, you are likely to find something of value in the discussion and be able to share from your own experiences if you choose. All are welcome.

name: Gulf Coast Community of Mindfulness
address: Hwy. 30A, Seagrove Beach, FL 32459 USA
notes: Every Wednesday we gather virtually as a community to practice meditation and mindfulness in the Plum Village tradition of the Venerable Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. The practice session consists of a short dharma talk, walking meditation/mindful movements/pranayama, sitting meditation, and dharma sharing.Every 3rd Wednesday of the month we recite either the 5 Mindfulness Trainings or the 14 Mindfulness Trainings. These trainings represent the Buddhist vision for global spirituality and ethic.To register, please visit our website.

name: Naples
address: 6200 Trail Blvd, Naples, FL 34108 United States
notes: We hold ongoing meditation, classes, and community events. Monthly Daylong and Residential Retreats. We also have several satellite sitting groups in St. Petersburg and Naples Florida.

name: Space Coast Mindfulness Practice Community
address: Unitarian Universalist Friendship Fellowship, 3115 Friendship Place, Rockledge, Florida 32955,  United States
notes: Sutra chanting, sitting/walking meditation, Dharma sharing, recitation of Five Mindfulness Trainings, Days of Mindfulness

name: St. Petersburg
address: 3150 5th Avenue N, St. Petersburg, FL 33713 United States
notes: We hold ongoing meditation, classes, and community events. Monthly Daylong and Residential Retreats. We also have several satellite sitting groups in St. Petersburg and Naples Florida.

name: Sun City Sangha
address: Sun City Center, Florida 33573 United States
notes: We meet weekly on Sundays at 3:30 for sitting and walking meditation as well as Dharma discussion. We also provide other opportunities for practice from time to time.

name: Peach Blossom Sangha
address: 3315 Chamblee Dunwoody Rd, Chamblee, GA 30341  United States
notes: This Atlanta area sangha meets at the Red Clay Buddhist Meditation Community Center. Drawing on the wisdom of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh and the larger Plum Village community, we gather weekly to practice cultivating peace, joy, solidity and freedom within and around us. The schedule includes sitting and walking meditation, dharma readings and sharing. Once a month we recite The Five Mindfulness Trainings. We meet in person and offer a Zoom option. All are welcome.

name: Honolulu Mindfulness Community
address: Bodhi Tree Meditation Center, 654A Judd St, Honolulu, HI 96817,  United States
notes: Started in 1998, we are a group of lay practitioners in the Plum Village tradition of the Vietnamese Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh. We meet regularly each week, have mindfulness classes in the spring and fall, host monthly mindful eating meditation luncheons, and have an annual retreat with Deer Park monastics.

name: Laughing Frog Sangha
address: Kihei, Hawaii, United States
notes: Our practice consists of 20 minutes of sitting quietly while focusing our attention on our breathing, then 20 minutes of silent walking, and another 20 minutes of sitting and breathing.It is so much easier to practice meditation with others than alone. We practice together in order to strengthen our ability to live in balance and harmony. Mindful breathing is the key.Please contact us for the location.

name: Awakening Heart Sangha
address: First Unitarian Church. 1800 Bell Ave. Des Moines, Iowa, 50315 United States
notes: We practice in the Plum Village tradition of our teacher, Thich Nhat Hanh. We practice mindful sitting, walking and Dharma sharing, and study teachings from Dharma books each week. We are beginner-friendly and we warmly welcome and affirm people of all ages, religions, genders, ethnicities, sexual orientations, abilities and levels of meditation experience.

name: Prairie Oaks Sangha
address: 23099 260th Avenue, LeClaire, Iowa 52753  United States
notes: Through our practice in the tradition of Plum Village and with the guidance of the mindfulness trainings, we are committed to healing and nurturing ourselves, our community, and the diverse natural ecology of Mother Earth, for they are not separate entities. All are welcome and celebrated!

name: Beginners Mind Sangha
address: Boise Institute of Buddhist Studies, 901 15th Street, Boise, Idaho 83702 United States
notes: We are a diverse group of people who practice mindfulness meditation as taught by Thich Nhat Hanh.

name: Fierce Compassion Sangha

notes: We meet every other week for two hours. We start with Dedication of Merit, mindful movement and then 30 minutes of meditation. After a short vegan snack/tea break, we begin Dharma sharing. We have a study group meeting on another day as well as periodic Days of Mindfulness.

name: Forest River Sangha

address: 210 Harvard Street, Brookline, Massachusetts 02446  United States
notes: Everyone is welcome to this new group as we explore ways to bring mindfulness into our lives, families, work, and society. Each evening we sit and walk and share a reading by Thich Nhat Hanh.

name: Path of Peace Sangha
address: First Universalist Society of Franklin, 262 Chestnut St, Franklin, MA 02038, United States
notes: We are dedicated to mindful living and engaged Buddhist practice. You do not have to be a Buddhist to practice with us. Many members continue to participate in other religious traditions while attending sangha. All are welcome.We practice mindfulness inspired by Vietnamese Buddhist monk Thich Nhat Hanh. The foundation for our being together is the Five Mindfulness Trainings, which are the Buddha’s teachings on the basis for a happy life.Our community practices mindful living in order to help reduce suffering while increasing joy, harmony and peace in ourselves, in our community and in the world. Mindfulness is the energy of being aware and awake to the present moment. It is the continuous practice of touching life deeply in every moment. To be mindful is to be truly alive, present and at one with those around you and with what you are doing. We bring our body and mind into harmony while we wash the dishes, drive the car or interacting with family, friends and colleaguesOur Practice includes:Mindful BreathingSitting MeditationWalking MeditationDharma SharingDharma talks

name: Peaceful Garden Sangha

name: Open Heart Sangha South

notes: Open Heart Sangha is a sitting and walking meditation group that practices mindfulness in the tradition of Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh. We practice meditation to cultivate peace and joy within and around us.We practice together weekly and offer more extended practice through Days of Mindfulness at least quarterly. We also seek to participate as a group in visits to Blue Cliff Monastery, to retreats, and to events designed to interconnect the larger community of Buddhist practitioners.We are an open and welcoming community for any and all who wish to practice with us, or who wish to explore the Dharma and the practice to determine whether or not they will undertake the practice as a commitment.

Fifth Mondays offer a special practice such as Touching the Earth.

name: Open Sky Sangha
address: 150 C Kelly Rd, Kalispell, MT 59901, United States
notes: Open Sky Sangha practices in the tradition of Ven. Thich Nhat Hanh. Each week we offer a guided meditation, walking meditation, silent sitting meditation during our first hour. We then transition with mindful tea into our second hour which varies each week. We may offer a Dharma practice talk by one of our members, a video streaming Dharma talk by Thay or the monastics, a tea ceremony, a book reading, touching the earth or some other mindfulness practice. All are welcome!

address: 107 W. Barcelona Road, Santa Fe, New Mexico 87505 United States
notes: We are seeking ways to integrate mindfulness into each moment in our lives. We practice sitting and walking meditation in the tradition of our beloved teacher, Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh at Unitarian Universalist Church Santa Fe. We enjoy short dharma talks and dharma sharing on mindfulness-based teachings by Thich Nhat Hanh. No experience is necessary. All are welcome. We invite you to practice meditation with us. If anyone would like to call/text Sue with questions, I am happy to meet them for tea and share about our sangha. If they prefer to email Donna, she also can answer questions about our sangha. We welcome all people to join us as an inclusive sangha.

name: Open Heart Sangha
address: 522 Paseo del Pueblo Norte, Taos, New Mexico,  United States
notes: We practice in the Plum Village tradition, including 5MTs, bells, flower offering, readings and recordings of Thay’s teachings, sitting and walking meditation, Dharma discussion, and offering merit.

name: Lotus Valley Sangha
address: Lohan School of Shaolin Kung Fu 4255 Spring Mountain Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89102  United States
notes: Sitting meditation, walking meditation, deep relaxation, Dharma Reading, Dharma sharing

name: Apple Blossom Sangha
address: Liverpool, New York 13088,  United States
notes: We practice mindful walking, sitting, and Dharma sharing, recite the Five Mindfulness trainings and listen to teachings from our beloved Thay and other Plum Village Dharma teachers.

name: Beacon of the Heart Sangha
address: St Andrew P and St. Luke Episcopal Church15 South Avenue ( *downstairs* - accessible ramp), Beacon, New York 12508 United States
notes: Beacon of the Heart is a meditation Sangha open to all. Inspired by early Buddhist teachings and meditation practices, as well as those of Thich Nhat Hanh, we offer secular mindfulness and meditation. We are a peer-led organization, and offerings are on a dana (donation) basis. These group sits are offered by community members with short introductions, a lightly guided meditation, and may include time for reflection and sharing. We affirmatively seek inclusion. For more information please see our forthcoming website.

name: Blooming Lilac Sangha
address: Westminster Rd, Arnold Park, Rochester, New York 14607, United States
notes: Blooming Lilac Sangha is one of hundreds of communities worldwide that practices mindfulness as taught by Vietnamese Zen Master, Thich Nhat Hanh. We welcome newcomers. If you are new to the practice, we have an orientation session on the 1st Sunday of the month. It is held at 3:00 pm if people RSVP. We offer meditation 4 times a week plus days of mindfulness. We practice sitting and walking meditation; talks by Thich Nhat Hanh, Dharma Sharing, recitation of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings; and other practices like Flower Watering; Beginning Anew; Gatha practice, Mindful Eating, etc.

name: Budding Flower Sangha
address: Education Buidling, Reformed Church of New Paltz, 92 Huguenot Street, New Paltz, New York 12561  United States
notes: Budding Flower Sangha has two weekly practice groups - one on Monday nights (Newburgh) and one on Friday mornings (New Paltz). We also have a monthly Day of Mindfulness in New Paltz on the third Sunday from 10 am - 2:30 pm. Weekly practice includes sitting and walking meditation, Dharma Sharing of a reading, mindful speech and deep listening besides monthly recitation of the Mindfulness Trainings. Day of Mindfulness encompasses extended practices like outdoor walking and singing meditation, Mindful Eating, Deep Relaxation and talks by Thay or Plum Village monastic/ lay teachers. All are welcome to join us. A suggested donation of $5 helps to support the Church rental space and the Sangha.

name: Budding Flower Sangha
address: Union Presbyterian Church, 44 Old Balmville Road, Newburgh, New York 12550, United States
notes: Budding Flower Sangha has two weekly practice groups - one on Monday nights (Newburgh) and one on Friday mornings (New Paltz). We also have a monthly Day of Mindfulness in New Paltz on the third Sunday from 10 am - 2:30 pm. Weekly practice includes sitting and walking meditation, Dharma Sharing of a reading, mindful speech and deep listening besides monthly recitation of the Mindfulness Trainings. Day of Mindfulness encompasses extended practices like outdoor walking and singing meditation, Mindful Eating, Deep Relaxation and talks by Thay or Plum Village monastic/ lay teachers. All are welcome to join us. A suggested donation of $5 helps to support the Church rental space and the Sangha.

name: Catskill Mountain Sangha
address: Woodstock, New York 12498  United States
notes: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

name: Cedar Knolls Sangha
address: Pondfield Rd., WestYonkers, New York 10708 United States
notes: We meet every Saturday morning between 10:30AM and Noon New York time on Zoom, with participants spanning the globe from Alaska to Canada to the U.S. and Europe. Our meetings include meditation, a reading, and sharing. On the first Saturday of the month we recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings. Local members in the NY area occasionally share mindful meals and visit Blue Cliff Monastery.

name: Gray Birch Sangha
address: Painted Post, NY 14870,  United States
notes: We were established in 2019. We were co-founded by an Order of Interbeing member and a local Yoga Instructor. We practice in the Plum Village Tradition offering online meditations and Dharma sharing. We plan trips to Blue Cliff Monastery for Days of Mindfulness throughout the year.

name: Green Island Sangha
address: Mindfulness Center @ Adelphi University, 1 South Avenue, Garden City, New York 11530 United States
notes: The Green Island Sangha is inspired by the teachings and practice of Vietnamese Zen Buddhist Master Thich Nhat Hanh. We are a grassroots Sangha, beginners and more experienced practitioners learning from and supporting one other on the path of awakening. We meet every Sunday, online and in person once a month at Adelphi University.

name: Kingfisher Sangha (East)
address: 4 Sherry Rd. Troy, New York, United States
notes: The meeting includes walking meditation, sitting meditation, dharma reading, and sharing in the tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. All are welcome–meditation instruction is available.

address: 20 Still Point Ln, Mechanicville, New York 12118 United States
notes: Kingfisher Sangha is a community of people who practice Thay's teachings. We are a Buddhist Community dedicated to mindful living and the engaged Buddhist practice of compassionate action and study. All are welcome!

notes: All are welcome here! We practice in the Plum Village Tradition of Teacher Thich Nhat Hanh. Together we enjoy Dharma readings, mindful sitting, walking meditation and Dharma sharing.

notes: All are welcome here! We practice in the Plum Village Tradition of Teacher Thich Nhat Hanh. Together we enjoy Dharma readings, mindful sitting, walking meditation and Dharma sharing.

notes: All are welcome here! We practice in the Plum Village Tradition of Teacher Thich Nhat Hanh. We do sitting and walking meditation, Dharma readings and Dharma sharing. Recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

address: 109 E. 50th St., New York, NY 10022
notes: Interfaith Zen Practice in TNH tradition.  Many people have their roots in Christianity, but all people are welcome

name: Middle Way Sangha

name: Rock Blossom Sangha

name: Sangha on the Hudson
address: Piermont, New York 10968 United States
notes: Sitting and walking meditation, inspirational reading, Dharma sharing, monthly recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

name: Spring Creek Sangha
address: Jeronimo Court, Pine Bush, NY 12566 US
notes: Typical Sangha gatherings include a dharma talk (read or viewed on video), sitting, walking and guided meditation, and dharma sharing. Music (practice songs and chants) and mindful movement may also be featured, as well as regularly scheduled Mindfulness Training recitations.

name: Stony Brook Sangha
address: 380 Nicolls Rd., Stony Brook, New York 11790 United States
notes: Stony Brook Sangha meets weekly for a silent sit, walking meditation and dharma sharing. We also have a book group which meets monthly and a  beach sit  in the summer mid-week. Please contact us for further details. All are welcome - experienced practitioners or new to the practice. Check us out on Facebook: Stony Brook Buddhist Sangha.

name: Village Moon Sangha
address: Delaware Avenue, Delmar, New York 12054,  United States
notes: All are welcome here. We practice in the Plum Village Tradition of Teacher Thich Nhat Hanh. Together we enjoy Dharma readings,mindful sitting, walking meditations and Dharma sharing.

name: Being Peace Sangha
address: 931 O'Bannonville Rd., Loveland, Ohio 45140 United States
notes: Mindfulness Community in the Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh hosted by Grailville

name: Blue Heron Sangha
address: The Martin de Porres Center, 2330 Airport Drive, Columbus, Ohio 43219  United States
notes: We are a small friendly mindfulness community that follows the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We practice guided, walking and sitting meditation. Then we either listen to part of a Thich Nhat Hanh or another teacher’s CD or DVD, have a reading, discussion, or do some mindful movement; we end with some tea and a little time to get to know each other.

name: Flowing Water Sangha
address: 1709 W. 69th Street, Cleveland, Ohio 44102-2957,  United States
notes: We sit for 35 minutes and read from a book followed by an brief discussion. Then we do intercessions and have a final minute of meditation ending with Thich Nhat Hanh's gatha,  The day is now ending...  Each person does his or her personal practice.

name: Sunflower Mindfulness Community
address: 201 West Brooklyn Street, Gambier, Ohio 43022 United States
notes: Open to all, no experience necessary. At our regular weekly sessions we practice guided, silent, and walking meditation; reading a short teaching from Thich Nhat Hanh or another Dharma teacher; and we close with Dharma sharing. Afterward we enjoy an optional tea and socializing time.

name: True Names Sangha
address: Cleveland, OH 44120 United States
notes: We meet via Zoom weekly on Thursdays evenings at 7:00 to 8:30pm. We meet in person once a month (weather permitting) at various locations in Northeast Ohio such as a park, museum or restaurant) decided by the Bell Master of that meeting. We do sitting and walking meditation, listen to Dharma talks by many teachers, recite the 5MTs each month, read and discuss Thay's books, chant, sing, laugh and dance.

name: Prairie Wind Sangha
address: Oklahoma City, Oklahoma 73112, United States
notes: We are an inclusive and diverse community grounded in the  art of mindful living  as taught by Thich Nhat Hanh and other teachers. Our gatherings include sitting and walking meditation along with other practices to deepen our understanding, compassion, and happiness.

name: Singing Stones Sangha
address: Sapulpa, Oklahoma 74066 United States
notes: Singing Stones Sangha is a community of persons of various spiritual traditions who gather to share mindful spiritual practice in the tradition and teachings of Zen Buddhist Master Thich Nhat Hanh

name: Friday Freshness Sangha
address: Leaven Community Center 5431 NE 20th Ave, Portland, Oregon 97211 United States
notes: Our Friday morning group welcomes anyone no matter their experience to join us for sitting and walking meditation, sharing the dharma from various sources and sharing our own wisdom in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

name: Merging Rivers Sangha
address: 243 SW J Street, Grants Pass, Oregon 97526 United States
notes: Our practices follow the Plum Village tradition and we have 2 local Dharma teachers who visit to help us in our practice. We offer guided meditations, walking meditation, deep relaxation and dharma sharing as part of our practices. We also offer Days of Mindfulness once a quarter.

name: Open Heart Sangha
address: Portland Dhamma Center1404 SE 25th Avenue, Portland, Oregon 97214 United States
notes: In the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh, our weekly in-person practice includes sitting and walking meditation, dharma reading and sharing. We host periodic days of mindfulness.

name: Reverence For Life Sangha
address: NW 20th Place & NW Everett St, Portland, Oregon 97210 United States
notes: The Reverence For Life Sangha will host a monthly 3-hour practice including 30 minutes of Sitting Meditation, Walking Meditation, and Eating Meditation, followed by 20 minutes of Dharma Sharing, Watching a Dharma Talk by a Plum Village Monastic or Reading a Passage from Thay, and Discussion. We will begin each session with 30 minutes for Tea and Mindful Conversation, to allow participants time to arrive before we begin meditation. From time to time we will recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

name: True Names Sangha Portland
address: Portland, Oregon 97209 United States
notes: We sit in meditation for 20 minutes; we walk in meditation for 10 minutes; we sit for another 20 minutes; we read selection from Thich Nhat Hanh; we have Dharma discussion (each person has the opportunity to speak about what they like, such as the reading, meditation, their lives, and others listen without responding. It is a safe place to talk.)

name: Cap City Water in the Wave
entity: Cap City Water in the Wave
address: 4811 Jonestown RoadHarrisburg, Pennsylvania  United States
notes: Guided, silent, walking meditation, veggie snack share, teaching from Thich Nhat Hanh and discussion.

name: Lancaster Water in the Wave
address: 110 Tulane Terrace, Lancaster, Pennsylvania 17603 United States
notes: Weekly guided, silent and walking meditation, veggie snack break, TNH teaching and discussion at Lancaster Friends Meeting House.

name: Laughing Rivers Sangha
address: Squirrel Hill Section, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania 15217,  United States
notes: We are a Mindfulness Practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. Laughing Rivers Sangha was started in 1991, and has grown continuously since. All welcome, long-term practitioners and newcomers alike. Our local Dharma teacher, Anthony Silvestre has been with the sangha since the early days.

name: Mossy Path Sangha
address: Indiana, Pennsylvania 15701 United States
notes: Our online practice includes a guided meditation for up to 30 minutes, Touching the Earth, and then a rotation of dharma sharing, sutra reading, tea ceremony, and 5 Mindfulness Trainings reading and discussion.

name: Pocono Creek Sangha
address: Unitarian Universalist Fellowship of the Poconos 118 Knight Street, Stroudsburg, Pennsylvania 18360 United States
notes: We are a member-led group. We practice sitting/walking meditation, including Plum Village meditations, Dharma sharing, recordings and readings of Thich Nhat Hanh's writings, and the recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings. We incorporate the sharing of personal stories and humor into our group.

name: Present Heart Sangha
address: 526 Wood St, Suite 402, Bethlehem, Pennsylvania 18018
notes: Weekly get together via Zoom or in person at chapel of Moravian Village in Bethlehem,Pa. We do readings, guided meditation and silent meditation. We also do Saturday morning retreats at Moravian Village.

name: True River Sangha
address: Heart Space, 15 West Baker Street, Media, Pennsylvania 19063, United States
notes: True River Sangha is a community of friends who come from diverse backgrounds, united by a shared commitment to practicing mindfulness in daily life. We gather to sit in meditation, explore the teachings, and support each other on the path of mindful living. Our offerings include weekly in-person and online gatherings, days of mindfulness, occasional retreats, and other events.

name: Water in the Wave Sangha
address: Unitarian Universalist of York925 S George St, York, Pennsylvania 17403  United States
notes: Water in the Wave Mindfulness Practice Community practices meditation and mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village.

name: Willow Branch Sangha
address: 1066 S New St, West Chester, Pennsylvania 19382 United States
notes: Willow Branch Sangha (WBS) is a group of friends from diverse spiritual backgrounds interested in the practice of mindfulness in daily living, inspired by the teachings of engaged Buddhism by Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. Our practice consists of a formal program including: chanting, a reading, time for both sitting and walking meditation, and discussion, followed by tea and conversation. All visitors are welcome.

name: Radiant Bell Sangha
address: Bell Street Chapel, 3 Bell St, Providence, Rhode Island 02909 United States
notes: We are part of the RI Community of Mindfulness practicing in the Plum Village Tradition.

name: Indigo Sangha
address: 151 Village Ponds Drive, Summerville, South Carolina 29483,  United States
notes: We are a welcoming and inclusive mindfulness practice community in the Plum Village tradition. We practice sitting and walking meditation, listening to talks, and sharing what is in our hearts. We want everyone who wishes to attend to join us. We especially encourage People of Color, LGBTQIA, and young practitioners (ages 18-35) and other diversities to attend. We provide simple instruction.

name: Three Streams Sangha
address: Cokesbury Rd, Greenwood, South Carolina 29649, United States
notes: We are a diverse group that meets in person and on-line. Practices include chanting/recitation, meditation, Dharma reading, and Dharma sharing. We practice primarily in the Plum Village Tradition but also incorporate teachings from other spiritual traditions. As a community, we practice the first two of the Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings: Openness and Non-Attachment to Views.

name: Compassionate Heart Sangha of Vermillion
address: 320 South University Street, Vermillion, SD 57069-3517, United States
notes: Compassionate Heart Sangha is an emerging sangha, however many have practiced in the Plum Village Tradition for 20 years.

name: Magnolia Sangha
address: Memphis, Tennessee 38111,  United States
notes: We have a Mindfulness practice, in the Thich Nhat Hanh Plum Village tradition. We practice sitting/walking meditation, Dharma discussion, Dharma sharing, monthly recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

name: Mountain Solid, Water Reflecting Sangha
address: Knoxville, Tennessee 37931 United States
notes: We have been studying the teachings and practicing in the tradition of Vietnamese Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh (“Thay”) since 1998. The group warmly welcomes individuals of all religions, Buddhist traditions, and cultures. We especially encourage those who are new to meditation to attend. While we do not offer formal lessons in meditation, there is an opportunity to ask questions, share experiences, and discover resources during the sharing circle.

name: Awakening Heart Community of Mindful Living
entity: Awakening Heart Community of Mindful Living
address: Dallas Meditation Center, 810 West Arapaho Road, Suite 98, Richardson, Texas 75080  United States
notes: Spirituality, meditation and the joy of mindful living are the basis of all our Sangha gatherings. We are intentionally very beginner-friendly and we warmly welcome and affirm people of all ages, religions, genders, ethnicities, sexual orientations, abilities and levels of meditation experience.

name: Cultivating Mindfulness Sangha
address: 4201 Trail Lake, Fort Worth, Texas 76109  United States
notes: Welcome to Cultivating Mindfulness! We are a group that is meeting both live near the TCU campus in Fort Worth, TX and on Zoom. We practice guided, sitting and walking meditation on Saturdays at 10 am in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village. We also have a Monday morning book dharma meeting from 10-11 am CST on Zoom. We welcome beginners and all other levels of meditation experience. Please contact Diane for more details.

name: Eastern Trails Sangha
address: 14000 La Palma Ranch Rd, MANCHACA, Texas 78652, United States
notes: Welcome to Eastern Trails Sangha. We enjoy learning new ways to cultivate and grow together. Our community is very fun and creative.

name: Interbeing Sangha
address: Dallas Meditation Center, 810 West Arapaho Road, Suite 98, Richardson, Texas 75080  United States
notes: All are welcome to join us for guided meditation, walking meditation, silent meditation and Dharma sharing every week.

name: Mindfulness Practice Community of Houston
address: 2025 W 11th St, Houston, Texas 77008 United States
notes: MPCH is a community of lay practitioners inspired by the teachings of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. We come together with the purpose to to support each other in learning to live with awareness. Our weekly practices include sitting/walking meditation, chanting, Dharma talks, Dharma sharing, monthly recitation of the Mindfulness Trainings.

name: Plum Blossom Sangha
address: Flow Yoga - Westgate, 4477 Lamar Blvd, Austin, Texas 78745  United States
notes: Plum Blossom Sangha is a community that practices mindfulness in the spirit and tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. The focus of the community is to cultivate the energy of mindfulness, understanding, and compassion in ourselves, our families, our community, and our world.

name: Plum Branch Sangha
address: Quaker House, 7053 N Vandiver, San Antonio, TX 78209 United States
notes: We practice sitting, walking, Dharma sharing, days of mindfulness, tea meditation and recitation of the Mindfulness Trainings.

name: Sangha de la Frontera
address:
Weslaco, Texas
 United States

name: Awakening Valley Sangha
address: 936 E 450 N., Provo, Utah 84606  United States
notes: A mindfulness community practicing in the Plum Village tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

name: Cloud Floating Free Sangha

notes: We meet 2ce weekly to practice sitting, walking and dharma sharing. We recite the 5 mindfulness Trainings 2ce monthly and the 14 Mindfulness Training 1ce monthly. We support tea ceremonies, book groups and documentary series.

name: Freedom Garden Sangha
address: 2209 E. Grace St., Richmond, Virginia 23222 United States
notes: Freedom Garden Sangha is an in-person sangha, meeting in Plum Village tradition. We practice sitting and walking meditation for the 1st half of our time together and then we vary our program: reading from one of Thich Nhat Hanh's books, listening to a Dharma talk, reading the Mindfulness Training or other programs. We usually end at 8:00pm. We welcome people who are new to meditation as well as those who have experience. We are committed racial equity.

name: Circle of Presence Sangha
address: Tenney Memorial Library, 4886 Main Street South, Newbury, Vermont 05051,  United States
notes: We are a welcoming group focused on the Plum Village Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh that welcomes people of all traditions to come join in mindfulness meditation with us.

name: Heart of the Valley MIndfulness Practice Center
entity: Heart of the Valley MIndfulness Practice Center
address: St Barnabas Episcopal Church, Parish Hall and on zoom, 262 Main St, Norwich, Vermont 05055,  United States
notes: We are a warm and welcoming community, and practice sitting and walking meditation, sharing, and other Plum Village practices. Several times a month, we read from one of Thay’s books. The Heart of the Valley Mindfulness Training Center meets in person every Tuesday morning, 9:00 to 11:00 am, at St Barnabas Episcopal Church, in Norwich, VT. Our sangha also has a zoom gathering every Wednesday evening, from 6:00 to 7:30 pm. We send out a mailing every weekend with information about the upcoming week, and a zoom link which doesn’t change.

name: Mountains and Rivers Mindfulness Community
address: Putney Commons Way, Putney, Vermont 05346 United States
notes: We practice sitting and walking meditation; recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings, read a book of Thich Nhat Hanh's, or watch a Plum Village video; and have Dharma sharing.

name: New Leaf Sangha
address: 294 Winooski Ave, Burlington, Vermont 05401 United States
notes: Our practice is in-person only (currently no Zoom options) and includes sitting meditation (two twenty-minute sits), ten minutes of walking meditation, reading together from one of Thay's books, and Dharma sharing.

name: Buddha's Bookbag Sangha
address: Java House, 210 W. Evergreen Blvd., #400, Vancouver, Washington 98660
notes: Since 2009, we offer a study group, using Thay's books, along with meditation, to nourish our practice and guide our dharma. Everyone is welcome and we will share the book at the meetings. Reach out to us as we sometimes change locations.

name: Mindfulness Community of Puget Sound
address: 1910 24th Ave. S, Seattle, Washington 98144  United States
notes: Seattle based peer led practice group in the Plum Village Tradition with 70 members in the Seattle area. A special People of Color Gathering is held twice a month on Tuesday evenings. We have a Family Sangha that meets on the 3rd or 4th Sunday of each month from 9:30 to 11:30 am.

name: Mudbay Lotus Sangha Olympia
address: Olympia, WA
notes: Open to all in the Plum Village Tradition

name: Thảnh Thơi Sangha (Tăng Thân Thảnh Thơi)
entity: Thảnh Thơi Sangha (Tăng Thân Thảnh Thơi)
address: Mercer Island, WA 98040,  United States
notes: Sitting/walking meditation, monthly talks by Thay and Plum Village monastics, Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five & Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings, deep relaxation, mindful eating

name: Woodside Sangha
address: Center for Spiritual Living Bellingham, 2224 Yew Street Road, Bellingham, Washington 98229 United States
notes: Welcome! We are a group practicing in the tradition of Plum Village within the context of the larger Buddhist circle of practice.

name: Four Lakes Sangha
address: Wingra Park
notes: Four Lakes Sangha is a branch of SnowFlower Sangha. Our aspiration is to create a welcoming, safe space for all to gather and practice mindfulness. We are family and kid friendly, with weekly children's activities (both together with and separate from adults). In the warmer months we meet outside. The general Sangha format starts with both children and adults signing practice songs, followed by group walking meditation, then a short guided meditation from the Plum Village app. Then the children separate for their own program while the adults practice silent sitting meditation, followed by a Dharma offering and ending with a focus on Dharma Sharing. Dharma Offerings are: 1st Sunday - 5 MT recitation, 2nd Sunday - Chanting or Touching the Earth, 3rd Sunday - Children's Program for all, 4th Sunday - Discourse Reading, 5th Sunday - Deep Relaxation.

name: Many Ways of Peace Sangha
address: 142 S. Aquila Ct., Eagle River, Wisconsin 54521  United States
notes: Many Ways of Peace Sangha meets weekly on Tuesday 2:00 - 4:00 pm at the home of Sangha leader Mary Jo Berner, 142 S. Aquila Ct, Eagle River, WI 54521 USA. Our sangha has been meeting since November, 2014, and incorporates music/singing, sitting meditation, discussion of Thay's teachings from his many books, personal sharing on the practice. New members are always welcome.

name: SnowFlower Sangha
address: Madison, Wisconsin 53703 United States
notes: Our Tuesday and Friday meetings are at Friends Meeting House, 1704 Roberts Ct., Madison. Our Sunday and Wednesday meetings are in people's homes; locations are publicized via our email list, or you can call me.

name: The Dancing River Mindfulness Sangha
address: 1224 11th Avenue #4, Grafton, Wisconsin 53024 United States
notes: We practice in the Plum Village tradition.

name: Windsong East Sangha
address: Sheboygan, Wisconsin, United States
notes: We read, discuss a Thich Nhat Hanh writing, do Dharma discussion and meditate for 15 - 30 minutes.

name: Mindful Monday Meditation

notes: Room 5 - Upstairs. Practices include sitting and walking meditation, mindful eating, teachings or readings and Dharma sharing

name: Pianoro
address: Via Grillini, 2, 40065 Pianoro BO, Italy
